#Text=Denver
#Text=Denver is the capital and largest city of Colorado , USA .
#Text=Known as " The Mile-High City " , Denver sits at an altitude of 5,280 feet ( 1,600 m ) above sea level and lies where the Great Plains give way to the Rocky Mountains .

column1: #Text=Denver is a large city and one of the fastest growing in the United States .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Denver is a bustling city of more than 650,000 people supporting a fast-growing metropolitan area of nearly 3 million people .

#Text=The city embraces its cowboy and mining past but also looks toward the future with a vibrant arts and performing arts scene , dozens of great outdoor festivals , and distinct neighborhoods each offering a unique experience .
#Text=You 'll find everything a cosmopolitan city has to offer including a spectacular view of and easy access to the beautiful Rocky Mountains , which are only 12 miles ( 19 km ) west of town .
#Text=Denver does have its growing pains .
#Text=Urban sprawl is becoming a problem , with the metropolitan area sometimes growing faster than the infrastructure can really handle , especially with public transportation .
#Text=Denver is generally a driving city , and some problems with pollution and traffic are a part of everyday life .
#Text=Large mass transportation and freeway expansion projects have been completed , including the popular light rail system .
#Text=By American standards , Denver is betting big on public transportation .
#Text=Climate
#Text=Denver residents enjoy a mild climate and the third most sunshine of any US state , with four pronounced seasons .
#Text=Heavy snowfalls can occur between October and March , often alternating with days of high temperatures and sunshine .
#Text=About once a year , a snowfall of over a few feet occurs .
#Text=Winter is also when the Denver area gets pounded by a phenomenon known as the " Chinook " .
#Text=That 's when air flows over the mountains to the west and sinks on the leeward ( eastern ) slopes of the foothills and warms up .
#Text=This raises air temperatures dramatically , which can last for several days .
#Text=If you 're planning to visit Denver during the winter , be prepared with full winter gear just in case , but also pack a light sweater and T-shirt ; the weather is usually very sunny and mild .
#Text=Spring in Denver is pleasant , though generally rather brief .
#Text=Trees begin budding by late March and are in full leaf by mid April to mid May .
#Text=March , on average , is Denver 's snowiest month .
#Text=By June , Denver enters its summer season .

#Text=Temperatures typically rise in earnest at this time , with most heat waves beginning in mid-June and continuing through July , usually Denver 's hottest month with temperatures in the high 80s to mid-90s ( ° F ) .
#Text=By late July , the southwest monsoon kicks in .
#Text=In August , short spells of thunderstorms occur about three to four days per week .
#Text=By late August , temperatures begin to drop with a noticeable difference between day time and night time temperatures .
#Text=As the days get shorter through September and October , daytime temperatures drop to the high 50s to mid-60s .
#Text=Slather on that sunscreen all summer long ; the rays are strong and the air is dry , with temperatures often reaching the upper 90s in July and August .
#Text=Autumn is a peaceful time to visit , with mild temperatures , little severe weather and lots of that famous clear blue sky .
#Text=You 'll get to see the trees display their fall colors , which usually peak around mid-September in the mountains and October in the city .
#Text=October usually brings the first snowfall of the season to Denver , although it 's very light .
#Text=By November , it 's clear that winter is on its way , with plenty of clouds , some snow and much cooler temperatures .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Denver International Airport ( DEN ) .

#Text=Commonly referred to as DIA , the airport is about 18 miles ( 29 km ) northeast of Downtown Denver and is one of the busiest airports in the nation , due to it being a hub for Frontier Airlines , United Airlines , and Southwest Airlines , and is a popular destination with other major domestic carriers .

#Text=Many connecting flights are made in DIA , and this airport is more pleasant than most to kill time , with plenty of public art displays , battery charging stations , and free Wi-Fi , as well as a decent selection of restaurants for an airport .
#Text=Detailed information on the airport can be found on its page .
#Text=Centennial Airport ( APA ) ( south of town , not far from the Denver Technological Center ) .
#Text=Rocky Mountain Metropolitan Airport ( BJC ) ( northwest of town , near Interlocken Business Park , Broomfield and Boulder and the closest airport to Downtown Denver ) .
#Text=On warm days , the density altitude may make takeoffs difficult ; Centennial and Rocky Mountain Airports thus have relatively long runways , to accommodate volumes of private jet traffic .
#Text=Flight visibility in the Denver area is often in excess of 100 miles ; weather fronts tend to travel quickly N-S along the Front Range .
#Text=For small planes , any direction but west is a good choice .
#Text=By car
#Text=I-25 ( north and south ) , I-70 ( east and west ) , and I-76 ( northeast ) are the major interstates leading in and out of the city .
#Text=I-225 and I-270 cross the Denver area .
#Text=U.S. Highway 40 connects Denver to Salt Lake City to the west .
#Text=Interstate 70 connects Denver to Summit County , the location of many major ski areas , to the west .
#Text=Interstate 25 connects Denver to Colorado Springs in the south and Cheyenne , Wyoming in the north .
#Text=U.S. Highway 36 connects to the northwestern suburbs and on to Boulder .
#Text=C-470 Connects to the southern end of E-470 ( also accessible from I-25 ) leading to the south , southwest , and western suburbs .
#Text=Toll Roads
#Text=There are a couple of major toll roads in the Denver area , and they can help you avoid some serious rush hour traffic on I-70 and I-25 .
#Text=E-470 connects the airport to the southeast , east , northeast and northwest suburbs , C-470 at its southern terminus , and the Northwest Parkway at its northern terminus , leading to Boulder .
#Text=E-470 is a " cashless " toll road - there are no longer any toll plazas and no way to pay tolls except via an in-car device or a billing service .
#Text=If renting a car , check to see if the rental car agency provides for proper billing ; otherwise , you may be subject to billed tolls and hefty service charges .
#Text=Tolls are $ 2 – 4 and without an in-car device , service charges can run to $ 25 or more .
#Text=Northwest Parkway connects to the north end of E-470 leading to north , northeast and northwest suburbs , and Boulder .
#Text=Also accessible from I-25 .
#Text=Tolls are up to $ 3 each , and booths accept only cash .
#Text=There 's no attendant between 10PM and 6AM , so pay attention to the signs ; though some booths still accept exact change , others require you to pay online or by mail .
